intro: Narcissus radians, commonly known as the radiant daffodil, is a species of flowering plant in the Amaryllidaceae family. It is characterized by its bright yellow, trumpet-shaped flowers and is native to southern Europe. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with strap-like leaves that are a deep green. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often blooming in early spring. The flowers are not only ornamental but also attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
